title: The potential outcomes if Trump strikes Iran
description: The US president has renewed threats against Iran, weeks after promising to come to the aid of anti-government protesters
content:
## Stay up to date with notifications from The Independent

Notifications can be managed in browser preferences.

Not nowYes please

Swipe for next article

[Donald Trump](https://www.independent.co.uk/topic/donald-trump) has renewed his [threat of military action against Iran](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/trump-iran-tehran-war-threat-us-military-armada-latest-b2909873.html), urging the Islamic Republic to make a ‘deal’ or face the consequences with a “massive armada” already en route to the region.

The US president said on Wednesday that [time was running out for Tehran to avoid a repeat of last summer’s strikes](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/trump-iran-truth-social-threat-military-armada-nuclear-weapons-b2909336.html) against the country’s nuclear facilities, warning this time would be “far worse”.

The [U.S.](https://www.independent.co.uk/topic/us) has been seeking a deal to curb [Iran](https://www.independent.co.uk/topic/iran)’s nuclear programme even after claiming to have totally destroyed it in a bombing campaign last June. However, officials fear the programme was not destroyed and that [the regime has been reconstituting](https://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/home-news/donald-trump-keir-starmer-iran-middle-east-beijing-b2909961.html) it. Iran denies trying to make a bomb, but says it is open to talks.

The decision to move a carrier strike group to the region gives Trump a wider range of options than he had earlier this month, when he vowed to come to the rescue of anti-government protesters being brutally killed and targeted by the regime.

But U.S. bases and partners in the region will be fearing an Iranian retaliation after regime officials threatened an ‘unprecedented’ response if provoked. _The Independent_ looks at what is likely to happen next in Iran.

![A US fighter jet is prepared on the deck of an aircraft carrier en route to the Middle East](https://static.independent.co.uk/2026/01/28/15/20-e687430
